intro: Cystopus flavus, commonly known as the yellow starwort, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its basal rosette of lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. It thrives in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows and along stream banks. Cystopus flavus is typically perennial and has a low-growing habit, making it a subtle yet distinctive component of its native habitats.
